raw_comment:
I notice that the younger people are, the more optimistic they are, and there aren't as many countries where older people say things are getting worse.

I wonder if each country itself has an impact on the percentages. Is it population age? Is it how well that singular country is doing?

This relates to my community somehow, I guess. I myself am pretty pessimistic on this issue but to be fair I am on most things. It is interesting how different countries have different outlooks though.

A "catchy" headline could be "Pessimistic percentages: Why are young peoples so optimistic?"
ace_sentences: Younger people are more optimistic than older people.
In many countries, older people say that things are getting worse.
I wonder if each country has an impact on the percentages.
I wonder if the population age in a country affects the percentages.
I wonder if how well a country is doing affects the percentages.
This issue relates to my community.
I am pessimistic about this issue.
I am pessimistic about most things.
